item.title: Python
item.description: I was introduced to Python during the last portion of the SDS 348 course, and I learned a couple of neat things that I wanted to share! One such thing is the use of regular expressions and the re.findall() function, which finds all matches and returns them as a list of strings, with each string representing one match. Here are common regular expressions used in Python: Now, let me show you how this can be applied in an example!
